newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India drifts after Bombay profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India drifts after Bombay profit-taking.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts ended little changed in slow trade on Thursday as the market continued to struggle for clear direction, traders said.
They said recent strength had stretched valuations, and the market would consolidate before attempting further gains.
Traders in Bombay said a six-day rally had been slowed by profit-taking, although they felt the market remained healthy. Bombay stocks have risen some five percent in six straight sessions.
Tata fell 15 cents to $12.35/13.35 and SBI collected 16 cents to $25.70/26.70.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed 0.12 points off at 83.10, with the premium over the local market at 26.55 percent from 27.09 percent.
Bombay's benchmark index closed up 12.43 points at 3,873.85.

Korean GDRs finished easier again in a slip from recent highs. The HSBC James Capel Korea GDR Index lost 2.17 points to 74.23 points, a premium of 41.19 percent over the local market from 45.50 percent.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index shed 1.04 points, or 0.86 percent, to 119.73, representing a discount to the local market of 2.11 percent.
